docs.snippet: For the first time in decades, the Royals, who endured 17 of 18 losing seasons before last year, begin a season with a realistic chance at the postseason, and all the pressure that comes with it....
docs.lead_paragraph: For the first time in decades, the Royals, who endured 17 of 18 losing seasons before last year, begin a season with a realistic chance at the postseason, and all the pressure that comes with it.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column analyzes prospects for the Kansas City Royals, who seem freshly confident after enduring 17 of 18 losing seasons before the previous year; holds that team has arrived at spring training with a realistic chance for the postseason, and all the pressure that goes with it.

headline.print_headline: Unfamiliar Player Enters Royals’ Camp: Confidence

docs.snippet: The Mets chose Kevin Plawecki, a top college catcher, 35th over all in 2012. About six months later, they acquired Travis d’Arnaud, then one of baseball’s best young catching prospects, in a trade....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mets chose Kevin Plawecki, a top college catcher, 35th over all in 2012. About six months later, they acquired Travis d’Arnaud, then one of baseball’s best young catching prospects, in a trade.
docs.abstract: New York Mets' decision to acquire top catchers Kevin Plawecki and Travis d'Arnaud in 2012 has given them the luxury of two promising players at the position; Plawecki has become a formidable batter during his time in the minor leagues, and is now at spring training working under d'Arnaud, who will be team's starter in 2014.

headline.main: A Luxury for the Mets: Two Promising Catchers
headline.print_headline: A Luxury for the Mets: Two Promising Catchers

docs.abstract: Heisman Trophy-winning quarterback Jameis Winston, also a baseball outfielder, monopolizes spotlight at the New York Yankees' camp as team faces off against Florida State during spring training.
